intro: Poikilogyne pentamera, commonly known as the five-angled sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert environments. Its scientific name reflects its five-angled stem structure and the presence of five stamens. Poikilogyne pentamera is a hardy species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in harsh climates.
